mdufa 0.4.0
  • Reference
  • Changelog

    Plot Cohort Closure Percentage

    plot_cohort_closure.Rd

    Creates a visualization of cohort closure percentages over time. Shows the percentage of submissions in each fiscal year cohort that have received a final decision.

    plot_cohort_closure(
  data,
  show_phe = TRUE,
  phe_label_y = NA,
  color_by_period = TRUE,
  facet_ncol = 4L,
  title = NULL,
  subtitle = NULL,
  caption = NULL
)

    Arguments

    data

    A data frame containing cohort closure metrics with columns: fy, org, percent_closed, status.

    show_phe

    Logical, whether to show COVID-19 Public Health Emergency highlighting (default: TRUE).

    phe_label_y

    Numeric, y-position for PHE label text. If NA (default), position is calculated automatically from data.

    color_by_period

    Logical, whether to color points by MDUFA period (default: TRUE). Requires report_mdufa_period column in data.

    facet_ncol

    Number of columns in facet grid (default: 4).

    title

    Optional plot title. If NULL, a default title is generated.

    subtitle

    Optional plot subtitle. If NULL, a default subtitle is used.

    caption

    Plot caption. If NULL (default), auto-generates a caption listing source reports with cutoff dates using source_caption_with_dates. If FALSE or NA, no caption is shown. If a character string, uses that value.

    Value

    A ggplot2 object that can be further customized with +.

    Details

    The plot displays cohort closure percentages using:

    • Points for each fiscal year/organization, with shape indicating status

    • Text labels showing the percentage value (100% labels are hidden)

    • Colors by MDUFA reporting period when enabled

    Unlike other plot functions, this one does not have a fade_open_cohorts parameter because the cohort closure percentage IS the metric being displayed.

    Examples

    if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Basic cohort closure plot
cohort_status |>
  filter(program == "510(k)") |>
  plot_cohort_closure()

# With custom title
cohort_status |>
  filter(program == "510(k)") |>
  plot_cohort_closure(
    title = "510(k) Cohort Closure Status"
  )
} # }
